findings.title: Possible Un-updated Pool State After Reward Allocation Update
findings.description: Modifying allocation points of a pool or adding a new pool without updating the accumulated reward per block can lead to distributing more or less reward than expected.

findings.title: Duplicate LP Token Pools Allowed
findings.description: SaffronStakingV2.add() allows adding more than once the same LPToken which will dilute the user's rewards since updatePool() relies on pool.lpToken.balanceOf(address(this)).

findings.title: Incorrect Token Deposit Logic in SFIRewarder
findings.description: It is unclear how tokens are deposited to SFIRewarder. However, we recommend adding a dedicated function that calls ERC20.transferFrom() to avoid any address input error when handling the transfer.

findings.title: Loss of Precision in accSFIPerShare
findings.description: The accSFIPerShare variable is updated by sfiReward * 1e18 / lpSupply and sfiReward uses integer division when dividing by totalAllocPoint, leading to potential precision loss.

findings.title: Lack of Validation in _allocPoint/totalAllocPoint
findings.description: The value of allocation point value is not validated in both set() and add() functions which can impact totalAllocPoint. For example, if totalAllocPoint is equal to zero then both updatePool and pendingSFI will most likely throw.

findings.title: Possible Inconsistencies in balance of Deflationary Tokens
Rewards Can Get Stuck
findings.description: Users might not be able to claim their already allocated and pending rewards if there is not enough SFI in the SFIRewarder contract to cover the entire reward period.
